alert.note: Alert for Lac Qui Parle; Swift (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 12:59AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Lac qui Parle and west central Swift Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1259 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Madison, or 21 miles southeast of Ortonville, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bellingham around 110 AM CDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 17 and 19. U.S. Highway 212 between mile markers 1 and 15. U.S. Highway 75 between mile markers 100 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for west central Minnesota.
